intro: Hieracium silboense, commonly known as the Silboense hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and coastal areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. It features upright stems with lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium silboense is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its distinctive appearance.
